SEARCH
Package engine.forPlayer.forAI

Class PawnStructureAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
engine.forPlayer.forAI.PawnStructureAnalyzer
public final class PawnStructureAnalyzer extends Object
The `PawnStructureAnalyzer` class evaluates the pawn structure of a player in a chess game, providing scores based on factors such as isolated pawns, doubled pawns, and proximity to pawn promotion. It implements modern techniques used by powerful chess engines to assess the strength and weaknesses of the pawn structure. The analysis includes penalties for isolated pawns and doubled pawns, and bonuses for pawn stacks and pawns close to promotion. This class follows a singleton pattern to ensure only one instance exists, accessible via the static get() method.
Author:
dareTo81, Aaron Ho

    • get

    • pawnStructureScore

      public int pawnStructureScore(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates the pawn structure of a player on the given chess board. The evaluation includes factors such as isolated pawns, doubled pawns, backward pawns, connected passed pawns, pawn chains, pawn majority, pawn islands, and pawn promotion. Adjust the weights and scoring values based on testing and analysis.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawn structure is being evaluated.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      The pawn structure score.

    • calculateConnectedPassedPawns

      private static int calculateConnectedPassedPawns(Player player, Board board)
      Calculates the bonus for connected passed pawns for the specified player on the given chess board. A connected passed pawn is one that has no friendly pawns in front or on adjacent files.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose connected passed pawns are being evaluated.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      The bonus for connected passed pawns.

    • isConnectedPassedPawn

      private static boolean isConnectedPassedPawn(Piece pawn, Board board)
      Checks if the specified pawn is a connected passed pawn. A connected passed pawn has no friendly pawns in front or on adjacent files.
      Parameters:
      pawn - The pawn being checked.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      True if the pawn is a connected passed pawn, false otherwise.

    • calculatePawnChains

      private static int calculatePawnChains(Player player, Board board)
      Calculates the bonus for pawn chains for the specified player on the given chess board. A pawn chain is a connected sequence of pawns on adjacent files.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawn chains are being evaluated.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      The bonus for pawn chains.

    • isPawnChain

      private static boolean isPawnChain(Piece pawn, Board board)
      Checks if the specified pawn is part of a pawn chain. A pawn chain is a connected sequence of pawns on adjacent files.
      Parameters:
      pawn - The pawn being checked.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      True if the pawn is part of a pawn chain, false otherwise.

    • calculatePawnMajority

      private static int calculatePawnMajority(int[] pawnsOnColumnTable)
      Calculates the bonus for pawn majority for the specified player. A pawn majority occurs when the player has more pawns on one side of the board than the opponent.
      Parameters:
      pawnsOnColumnTable - The pawn distribution on each column.
      Returns:
      The bonus for pawn majority.

    • calculatePawnIslands

      private static int calculatePawnIslands(int[] pawnsOnColumnTable)
      Calculates the penalty for pawn islands for the specified player. A pawn island is a group of one or more connected pawns separated from other pawns by empty files.
      Parameters:
      pawnsOnColumnTable - The pawn distribution on each column.
      Returns:
      The penalty for pawn islands.

    • calculateIsolatedPawnPenalty

      private static int calculateIsolatedPawnPenalty(int[] pawnsOnColumnTable)
      Calculates the penalty for each isolated pawn for the specified player on the given chess board. An isolated pawn is one that has no friendly pawns on adjacent files.
      Parameters:
      pawnsOnColumnTable - The pawn distribution on each column.
      Returns:
      The penalty for isolated pawns.

    • calculatePawnColumnStack

      private static int calculatePawnColumnStack(int[] pawnsOnColumnTable)
      Calculates the penalty for each doubled pawn for the specified player on the given chess board. A doubled pawn is one that has another pawn on the same file.
      Parameters:
      pawnsOnColumnTable - The pawn distribution on each column.
      Returns:
      The penalty for doubled pawns.

    • createPawnColumnTable

      private static int[] createPawnColumnTable(Player player)
      Creates a table representing the distribution of player pawns on each column of the chess board.
      Parameters:
      player - The current player
      Returns:
      An array representing the pawn distribution on each column.

      Returns:
